newsitem.title: HONG KONG: S.Korea bought five cargoes of sugar - HK traders.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea bought five cargoes of sugar - HK traders.

text.p: Hong Kong sugar traders said on Tuesday that South Korea recently bought up to five cargoes of raw sugar from Thailand for delivery in March or April, but they did not pin down a firm price.
"They bought about four to five cargoes -- the price level was way low, close to the market value," said one senior trader.
Another trader said the premium for the sugar was 30 to 35 points above the market rate.
The sources said the shipment was for delivery in March or April.
London sugar traders said South Korea bought as many as five cargoes of sugar this week, citing the price at around $265 per tonne for raw sugar for March delivery.
